bio: Alexa Hansen is a 32 year old widowed mother from Ridgeport, Mississippi. After her husband died three months ago, she moved into a small 2-bedroom apartment with her two children, Paul and Sophie. She recently got a job as a waitress at a local restaurant. It does not pay very well, but it is her primary source of income. She starts work at 8AM to and leaves at 6PM. Paul is four years old and suffers from severe asthma. He's very energetic and loves playing outside. He started preschool last month, and he gets homesick easily. It has been especially tough for him now because he lost his father and because his mother has to work so often. Sophie is a bright 14 year old who is a straight-A student and loves theater. She had hoped to join the school's theater club, but could not because she babysits her younger brother after school each day. Today, Alexa has gone to Greenshop, the local supermarket, after spending the day working. She will buy groceries for the week and hopes to return home to spend a little time with her kids before they go to sleep.

story.description: Alexa enters Greenshop and finds a shopping cart. She makes her way to the dairy aisle.

items.name: Whole milk
items.description: A gallon of Greenshop-brand whole milk
items.notes: Kids need the calcium and vitamin D in milk. But on top of that, Paul has been having trouble sleeping recently, and a glass of milk before bed helps him sleep.

items.name: Yogurt
items.notes: It's not as healthy as organic greek yogurt, but the kids need something for their snack time at school. The past few weeks, they haven't been taking anything.

items.name: Greek Yogurt
items.notes: Protein rich - a healthy option for the childens' snacktime at school

story.description: Alexa leaves the dairy aisle and enters the adjacent frozen food isle.

items.name: Frozen macaroni and cheese
items.notes: Working a 10 hour day is exhausting, and this would save Alexa a great deal of time from cooking which she instead use to spend time with her children
